author: liberosist
content:
I'm reminded of this post: https://ethresear.ch/t/bitcoin-cash-a-short-term-data-availability-layer-for-ethereum/5735

It seems to me like Solana is offering dirt cheap data availability (no concrete figures but seems quite negligible given their obscene state growth: feel free to add numbers), subsidized by VCs pouring in hundreds of millions. Should certainly have backup committees (or even a backup consensus mechanism) in case Solana fails, but why should a validium not leverage this? You could probably do Solana-like throughput while being more secure than Solana native smart contracts given state root transitions proved to Ethereum. Building in forward compatibility to Ethereum data shards as a bonus. Of course, we have to get to ZK rollups first and saturate that.

Celestia is also pretty interesting, definitely paying attention to a new breed of L1s that are focused on data availability
